column4: Hi #ubuntu, I'm having an issue with my video card, namely that the screen goes blank often unless nomodeset is set.
I'm using an asus zenbook with some sort of onboard intel (i915)
which of the ZenBooks? My wife has one.
ux21e I think
she has the 13 inch, is that the new Ivy-Bridge one, or prior to?
I'm not sure actually, been a while since I looked at this box
okay, so it's older. Hang a sec.
yeah it is, thanks!
so, I don't think it'd be...well, look here at the Power Saving Optimizations (or all of it, rather), maybe this will help: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AsusZenbook
yeah I followed that guide when I set it up. I've messed a bit with the powersaving options but not a lot
check with those, I don't know exactly what the i915.semaphores=1 does, but may help?
I'll play with it :)
in your /etc/default/grub
huh, interesting.
I found a couple posts from people with the same issue, but not much in the way of solutions :s
on the forums? can I see the link?
I'll see what I can find, was on a different install when I was searching.
I can confirm that on my Wife's ux31e (or whatever the 13" is), she only has the weird Sentelic touchpad issue. I wonder why it's different.
on 12.04 that is
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-video-intel/+bug/991902
that's one of the links
I should have bought the larger model :D
Be back in a second, I should get some breakfast. Thanks for the assistance!
Good luck :s sorry I couldn't be of more immediate help This bug report looks like it's on the right track
